summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General documenting a voluntary telephonic interview conducted on September 22, 2021, with Jeffrey McKenzie, a former Senior Customer Support Representative for Signet Electronic Systems Inc. The interview was part of an OIG investigation into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York in August 2019, focusing on McKenzie's technical support role regarding the facility's camera system.

persons.name: Jeffrey McKenzie
persons.role: Former Senior Customer Support Representative, Signet Electronic Systems Inc.
persons.context: He was interviewed by the OIG regarding his technical support work on the camera system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York around August 2019, as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He is identified as the BOP inmate (Register Number 76318-054) who died while housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, and whose death is the subject of the OIG investigation.

connections.description: McKenzie was interviewed as a witness in the OIG investigation into Epstein's death due to his technical support role for the MCC New York camera system around the time of the incident.

events.title: OIG Interview of Jeffrey McKenzie
events.description: Special Agents from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary telephonic interview with Jeffrey McKenzie regarding the camera system technical support and upgrades at MCC New York around August 2019, as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Camera System Work at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey McKenzie, as a Senior Customer Support Representative for Signet Electronic Systems, assisted the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York with technical support and upgrades to their camera system.

events.title: Signet Service Request #24975
events.description: A service request (Signet Service Request #24975) was issued for MCC New York, documented as an attachment to the OIG interview report.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General interviewed Jeffrey McKenzie on September 22, 2021, as part of its investigation into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York.
McKenzie was the Senior Customer Support Representative for Signet Electronic Systems Inc. who provided technical support and upgrades for the camera system at MCC New York around August 2019.
A specific service request (Signet Service Request #24975 dated August 8, 2019) for MCC New York was discussed during the interview and is attached to the report.
The document is an OIG memorandum that contains neither recommendations nor conclusions, and is restricted from distribution outside the receiving agency.
